verses.kjv: And Nadab and Abihu, the sons of Aaron, took either of them his censer, and put fire therein, and put incense thereon, and offered strange fire before the LORD, which he commanded them not.
verses.web: Nadab and Abihu, the sons of Aaron, each took his censer, and put fire in it, and laid incense on it, and offered strange fire before LORD, which he had not commanded them.
verses.ct: Nadab and Abihu, two of Aaron's sons, each grabbed his censer, put fire in it, laid incense on top, and offered unauthorized fire before the LORD — something he had never commanded them to do.

verses.kjv: And there went out fire from the LORD, and devoured them, and they died before the LORD.
verses.web: Fire came out from before LORD, and devoured them, and they died before LORD.
verses.ct: Fire blazed out from the LORD and consumed them, and they died right there in the LORD's presence.

verses.kjv: Then Moses said unto Aaron, This is it that the LORD spake, saying, I will be sanctified in them that come nigh me, and before all the people I will be glorified. And Aaron held his peace.
verses.web: Then Moses said to Aaron, “This is what LORD spoke of, saying, ‘I will show myself holy to those who come near me, and before all the people I will be glorified.’ ” Aaron held his peace.
verses.ct: Moses said to Aaron, "This is what the LORD meant when he said, 'I will be treated as holy by those who come near me, and before all the people I will be glorified.'" Aaron said nothing.

verses.kjv: And Moses called Mishael and Elzaphan, the sons of Uzziel the uncle of Aaron, and said unto them, Come near, carry your brethren from before the sanctuary out of the camp.
verses.web: Moses called Mishael and Elzaphan, the sons of Uzziel the uncle of Aaron, and said to them, “Draw near, carry your brothers from before the sanctuary out of the camp.”
verses.ct: Moses called for Mishael and Elzaphan, sons of Aaron's uncle Uzziel, and told them, "Come here and carry your cousins' bodies away from the sanctuary and out of the camp."

verses.kjv: So they went near, and carried them in their coats out of the camp; as Moses had said.
verses.web: So they came near, and carried them in their tunics out of the camp, as Moses had said.
verses.ct: So they came forward and carried the bodies out of the camp, still in their tunics, just as Moses had instructed.

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto Aaron, and unto Eleazar and unto Ithamar, his sons, Uncover not your heads, neither rend your clothes; lest ye die, and lest wrath come upon all the people: but let your brethren, the whole house of Israel, bewail the burning which the LORD hath kindled.
verses.web: Moses said to Aaron, and to Eleazar and to Ithamar, his sons, “Don’t let the hair of your heads go loose, and don’t tear your clothes, so that you don’t die, and so that he will not be angry with all the congregation; but let your brothers, the whole house of Israel, bewail the burning which LORD has kindled.
verses.ct: Then Moses said to Aaron and his surviving sons Eleazar and Ithamar, "Don't let your hair hang loose, and don't tear your clothes — if you do, you'll die, and the LORD's anger will fall on the entire community. But the rest of Israel, your fellow people, may mourn the fire the LORD sent."

verses.kjv: And ye shall not go out from the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, lest ye die: for the anointing oil of the LORD is upon you. And they did according to the word of Moses.
verses.web: You shall not go out from the door of the Tent of Meeting, lest you die; for the anointing oil of LORD is on you.” They did according to the word of Moses.
verses.ct: "And don't leave the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, or you'll die, because the LORD's anointing oil is on you." They did exactly what Moses said.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Aaron, saying,
verses.web: Then LORD said to Aaron,
verses.ct: Then the LORD spoke directly to Aaron:

verses.kjv: Do not drink wine nor strong drink, thou, nor thy sons with thee, when ye go into the tabernacle of the congregation, lest ye die: it shall be a statute for ever throughout your generations:
verses.web: “You and your sons are not to drink wine or strong drink whenever you go into the Tent of Meeting, or you will die. This shall be a statute forever throughout your generations.
verses.ct: "Whenever you or your sons enter the Tent of Meeting, do not drink wine or any other strong drink, or you will die. This is a permanent rule for every generation that follows you.

verses.kjv: And that ye may put difference between holy and unholy, and between unclean and clean;
verses.web: You are to make a distinction between the holy and the common, and between the unclean and the clean.
verses.ct: You must be able to tell the difference between what is holy and what is common, and between what is unclean and what is clean.

verses.kjv: And that ye may teach the children of Israel all the statutes which the LORD hath spoken unto them by the hand of Moses.
verses.web: You are to teach the children of Israel all the statutes which LORD has spoken to them by Moses.”
verses.ct: You are also responsible for teaching the people of Israel every law the LORD has given them through Moses."

verses.kjv: And Moses spake unto Aaron, and unto Eleazar and unto Ithamar, his sons that were left, Take the meat offering that remaineth of the offerings of the LORD made by fire, and eat it without leaven beside the altar: for it is most holy:
verses.web: Moses spoke to Aaron, and to Eleazar and to Ithamar, his sons who were left, “Take the meal offering that remains of the offerings of LORD made by fire, and eat it without yeast beside the altar; for it is most holy;
verses.ct: Moses spoke to Aaron and his remaining sons, Eleazar and Ithamar: "Take the grain offering that's left over from the LORD's fire offerings and eat it without yeast beside the altar, because it is most holy.

verses.kjv: And ye shall eat it in the holy place, because it is thy due, and thy sons’ due, of the sacrifices of the LORD made by fire: for so I am commanded.
verses.web: and you shall eat it in a holy place, because it is your portion, and your sons’ portion, of the offerings of LORD made by fire; for so I am commanded.
verses.ct: Eat it in a holy place, because it's your rightful share — yours and your sons' — from the LORD's fire offerings. That's what I've been commanded to tell you.

verses.kjv: And the wave breast and heave shoulder shall ye eat in a clean place; thou, and thy sons, and thy daughters with thee: for they be thy due, and thy sons’ due, which are given out of the sacrifices of peace offerings of the children of Israel.
verses.web: The waved breast and the heaved thigh you shall eat in a clean place, you, and your sons, and your daughters with you: for they are given as your portion, and your sons’ portion, out of the sacrifices of the peace offerings of the children of Israel.
verses.ct: The breast that was waved and the thigh that was lifted up as an offering — you may eat those in any ceremonially clean place. You, your sons, and your daughters may all share in them, because they are your rightful portion from the peace offerings the Israelites bring.

verses.kjv: The heave shoulder and the wave breast shall they bring with the offerings made by fire of the fat, to wave it for a wave offering before the LORD; and it shall be thine, and thy sons’ with thee, by a statute for ever; as the LORD hath commanded.
verses.web: The heaved thigh and the waved breast they shall bring with the offerings made by fire of the fat, to wave it for a wave offering before LORD. It shall be yours, and your sons’ with you, as a portion forever, as LORD has commanded.”
verses.ct: The lifted thigh and the waved breast must be brought along with the fat portions of the fire offerings and waved before the LORD as a wave offering. After that, they belong to you and your children as a permanent share, just as the LORD has commanded."

verses.kjv: And Moses diligently sought the goat of the sin offering, and, behold, it was burnt: and he was angry with Eleazar and Ithamar, the sons of Aaron which were left alive, saying,
verses.web: Moses diligently inquired about the goat of the sin offering, and, behold, it was burned. He was angry with Eleazar and with Ithamar, the sons of Aaron who were left, saying,
verses.ct: Later, Moses went looking for the goat of the sin offering and discovered it had been completely burned up. He was furious with Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron's surviving sons, and demanded:

verses.kjv: Wherefore have ye not eaten the sin offering in the holy place, seeing it is most holy, and God hath given it you to bear the iniquity of the congregation, to make atonement for them before the LORD?
verses.web: “Why haven’t you eaten the sin offering in the place of the sanctuary, since it is most holy, and he has given it to you to bear the iniquity of the congregation, to make atonement for them before LORD?
verses.ct: "Why didn't you eat the sin offering in the holy place? It's most holy! God gave it to you so you could bear the guilt of the community and make atonement for them before the LORD.

verses.kjv: Behold, the blood of it was not brought in within the holy place: ye should indeed have eaten it in the holy place, as I commanded.
verses.web: Behold, its blood was not brought into the inner part of the sanctuary. You certainly should have eaten it in the sanctuary, as I commanded.”
verses.ct: Its blood wasn't taken inside the sanctuary, so you absolutely should have eaten the meat in the holy place, just as I commanded!"

verses.kjv: And Aaron said unto Moses, Behold, this day have they offered their sin offering and their burnt offering before the LORD; and such things have befallen me: and if I had eaten the sin offering to day, should it have been accepted in the sight of the LORD?
verses.web: Aaron spoke to Moses, “Behold, today they have offered their sin offering and their burnt offering before LORD; and such things as these have happened to me. If I had eaten the sin offering today, would it have been pleasing in LORD’s sight?”
verses.ct: Aaron answered Moses, "Look — today my sons offered their sin offering and their burnt offering before the LORD, and yet this tragedy has struck me. If I had eaten the sin offering today, would the LORD really have been pleased with that?"

verses.kjv: And when Moses heard that, he was content.
verses.web: When Moses heard that, it was pleasing in his sight.
verses.ct: When Moses heard this, he accepted Aaron's answer.
